basics.name: Tobias Pfeiffer
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a software engineer, deeply interested in agile methodologies, teaching, web technologies, object oriented programming and developing applications in a team-oriented approach. I contribute to a variety of open source projects (for instance Shoes, Hackety Hack and after_do), engage in a multitude of community events (e.g. Ruby user Group berlin) and enjoy attending and speaking at conferences.

work.summary: Software engineer and lecturer teaching courses and working on projects.
highlights: Taught three introductory level web development courses at the Humboldt-University Berlin
Prepared material for an advanced level Ruby on Rails course
Built a website to show screencasts in a HTML friendly way using HTML5 and popcorn.js

work.summary: Student for the JRuby organization, working on the Shoes 4 code base improving performance, enhancing functionality and refactoring the code to achieve better readability and maintainability.
Working on a spree ecommerce application.
Various jobs at the working group for Internet Technologies at the Hasso Plattner Institute including working as a corrector for the lectures „Internet- and WWW-Technologies“ and „Internet Security“.

volunteer.summary: The Ruby User Group Berlin is a monthly meetup of people interested in Ruby and related topics. Each meeting consists of 3 presentations and a couple of lightning talks. Currently the user group attracts between 80 and 120 attendees per meeting. My main responsibilities are organizing venues, contacting speakers and moderating the meetings as well as the mailing list. Sometimes I also give presentations.

Rails Girls helps to diversify the tech community by teaching beginners how to program. I support Rails Girls Berlin by coaching at workshops and hackdays. Since March 2013 I coach a weekly project group to help interested attendees dig deeper into programming. I also helped Rails Girls Summer of Code 2013 with the team selection process, as well as mentoring two Rails Girls Summer of Code teams.
highlights: Helped multiple attendees to grow into a junior developer position from absolute beginners
Created a well received introductory presentation, which I presented multiple times

volunteer.summary: I'm part of the Shoes community for over three years now and since September 2013 I am the maintainer of the Shoes 4 project.
I like to go to conferences and helped organize some of them.
highlights: member of the program committee and a track host for "Monoliths and Microservices" and "Software Craftsmanship" at GOTO Berlin 2014
volunteer at Agile Dev Practices 2013, GOTO Berlin 2013, JRubyConf.eu 2014 and eurucamp 2014

education.thesis: Collaborative Learning in a Massive Open Online Course environment
Event Adapters and Correlation in Process Engines
highlights: Participated in a nine month, near full time team project develloping a process engine
Participated in fifty person Scrum project to build a Customer Relationship Management system
